description.narrative: AGIR (Acções para uma Governação Inclusiva e Responsável), is a five-year (2010-2014) programme on governance, implemented by Oxfam in Mozambique and funded by Swedish (186,6 million SEK # # 20 million for 5 years) and Dutch (1 million Euro/year) Embassies. AGIR supports civil society organisations in Mozambique with the final objective of ensuring that they are strong and vibrant enough to monitor governance and thus influence changes in Mozambique. The programme gives support through core funding to 20(twenty) partners. Essentially, the programme´s approaches of support is three fold: 1) to strengthen CSO institutional/organisational capacity; 2) to facilitate links, synergies and networks among CSOs; and, 3) to ensure that CSOs benefit from good donorship through establishment of basket/common funds and coordination among donors. In turn, these approaches will bring about changes in the Mozambican society, particularly on issues related to transparency and financial accountability and participation and social accountability. Recently, and after recommendation by the donors, Oxfam submitted a proposal for the extension of the programme for further 6 (six) years of implementation (with a budget of approximately # 50 million). Donors have not given feedback on the new proposal but it is supposed to start on the 1st January 2015, with 24 partners (18 current plus 6 new potential partners).
